body:
Normally any well defined GLFW application needs to call `glfwTerminate()` upon exit. But as someone might to close and reopen a window - i guess - this behaviour is not desired.

Can any other macOS user confirm this?
@TheMasterMaind I've added `glfwTerminate` call to the example, but note the issue isn't about that. I think the window should be gone after calling `glfwDestroyWindow`, but it's not.
Yes, I am observing the same hanging window issue with Mac OS 10.14.5 and GLFW 3.3.

issue.title: Hang on window close on macOS

repository.name: GLFW.jl
repository.description: Julia interface to GLFW, a multi-platform library for creating windows with OpenGL contexts and managing input and events.

issue.body:
If I run the example on the README, the window doesn't close when clicking the close button. Julia does get out of the `WindowShouldClose` loop, but the `DestroyWindow` call has no effect.  I have to force-quit (from the GLFW icon that appears in my dock), which in turn terminates julia (with a signal 15). 

This is on a dev'd copy of GLFW. I ran into this issue while trying out SpinnakerGUI.jl, which uses CImGui.jl.

body: I can also confirm, at least using the Julia bindings referenced above. Adding an explicit `glfwTerminate` call had no effect, but adding an extra `glfwPollEvents` call after the `glfwDestroyWindow` closed the window as expected.

issue.title: Added "GLFW.PollEvents()" after GLFW.DestroyWindow(nw)

issue.body:
Using 
Julia Version 1.3.0-rc2.0 (2019-09-12)
AbstractPlotting v0.9.10 #as/title-parent 
macOS Mojave

After plotting something I have a Makie window open with the scene. If I try to close it with the 'x' button, the content of the window becomes black, but the window is still open. After clicking the button one more, a spinning wheel appears, hanging the window but it doesn't close the window.

Clicking 'force quit' in the macOS dock crashes Julia.

body: This should be fixed now with the hack introduced by c819f27ce3e6639b4d4b432c0e5191e5c26a9d31. Thank you for the bug report!
@dcabecinhas Noted. I will see what can be done about this. The process doing this is unbundled?

@elmindreda Thanks for looking into it.

I'm not sure what you mean by "unbundled process". I can notice the behavior by running the simple C program I posted from the command line.

What happens: Running the above C code from the command line spawns a window with an associated icon on the dock. However, when the window is closed, the icon remains active on the dock (and visible as "not responding" on the Activity Manager.app) until the `sleep(20)` is over.

What I expected: When `glfwTerminate()` is executed all GLFW window related artifacts and processes should be gone, even if the C program has not terminated yet.

In the context of a long running process that spawns a GLFW window from time to time, having window artifacts remain after `glfwTerminate()` is confusing for users.
thanks @dcabecinhas for showing that this issue persists with a simple C example. That means I can stop looking for problems in Makie I assume
